definition: to lift/to raise/(of two or more persons) to carry
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to raise one's head/to gain ground/account name, or space for writing the name on checks, bills etc
to artificially inflate/to bid up (the price)
to lift sth up/to elevate sb/to honor sb (with compliments, gifts, promotions etc)/to show great regard/to speak highly/Taiwan pr. [tai2 ju3]
to be generous (idiom)/to be magnanimous/Give me a break!
to bicker/to argue for the sake of arguing/to carry on poles (together with sb else)/to carry a coffin on poles
to carry sb in a sedan chair/flatter/sing praises
fail to appreciate sb's kindness/not know how to appreciate favors
palanquin with eight carriers/(fig.) lavish treatment
(Tw) to pull sth up/(fig.) to give a boost to/to support

sentences.english: We will try and carry him on board the tartan .
sentences.chinese: 我们设法来把他抬到船上去吧。

sentences.english: The machine gun hailed over our heads.
sentences.chinese: 机关枪的火力压得我们抬不起头来。

sentences.english: Keep the horse's head up and still to make your farrier's work easier.
sentences.chinese: 让马抬着头并且静止能使蹄铁匠的工作更加容易。

sentences.english: Kim was carried out of the ring by stretcher and rushed to Desert Springs Hospital.
sentences.chinese: 随后，金被担架抬出拳击台，送往沙漠甘泉医院。

sentences.english: The neck should be raised and arched, the nose line vertical.
sentences.chinese: 马匹颈部高抬弓弯，头部的鼻线垂直。

sentences.english: Lift him on the horse, Scarlett, and face his head toward its tail.
sentences.chinese: 史考烈特，将他抬上马，头面对着尾巴。

sentences.english: Can you lift the basket onto the truck?
sentences.chinese: 你能把篮子抬上卡车吗？

sentences.english: Lend me a hand to shift this television-set.
He was taken to hospital with his legs a mass of bleeding flesh .
sentences.chinese: 他被抬到医院，他的腿血肉模糊。

sentences.english: Lifted his eyes to the heavens, and, folding his hands as in childhood.
sentences.chinese: 他抬眼看着天空，合起双手，像儿时那样。

sentences.english: Blushing, she turns her head without a qualm.
One day four coolies came with a huge sea turtle for sale.
sentences.chinese: 一天，四个苦力抬来一只巨大的海龟出售。

sentences.english: Most of the miners were unable to walk unassisted and some were placed on stretchers.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的矿工不能独立行走，还有一些被抬在担架上。

sentences.english: The mouse's job was to fetch the water from the well and carry it in.
sentences.chinese: 老鼠的工作是到井边打水并抬进屋内。

sentences.english: His legs were sticking out as they carried him past me.
sentences.chinese: 当他们抬着他经过我的时候，他的腿耷拉在外面。

sentences.english: He flicked his chin and she followed him out to the street.
sentences.chinese: 他抬了抬下巴，她就跟着走到了街道上。

definition: to reach out with one's hand/to hold out a hand/(fig.) to beg/to get involved/to meddle
to get up/to leave/to set forth
to support with the hand/to help sb up/to support oneself by holding onto something/to help
to hint/to indicate (an idea to sb)
to move (sth) aside/to step aside/to move over (when sitting on a bench)/to shift (one's gaze)
to heave/to lift/to raise up/to uphold
to lend an arm to support sb
to tremble/to shake out/to reveal/to make it in the world
